seriesJson.title: America on stage
seriesJson.description: Selected American plays written prior to 1900.  Each is an expression of contemporary popular sentiments.  Radio adaptations of theatre performances, using selected excerpts.

node.title: "Margaret Fleming" by James Herne
node.description: This program presents a radio play of Margaret Fleming by James A. Herne (1890).

node.title: "Shenandoah" by Bronson Howard
node.description: This program presents a radio play of Shenandoah by Bronson Howard (1888).

node.title: "Rip Van Winkle" by Joseph Jefferson
node.description: This program presents a radio play of Joseph Jefferson's Rip Van Winkle (1865).

node.title: "Francesca da Rimini" by George Boker
node.description: This program presents a radio play of Francesca da Rimini by George Henry Boker (1901).

node.title: "Minstrel Shows" from 1830
node.description: This program presents excerpts from the various minstrel shows.

node.title: "Uncle Tom's Cabin" by George Aiken
node.description: This program presents a radio play of Uncle Tom's Cabin by George L. Aiken (1852).

node.title: "The Poor of New York"by Dion Boucicault
node.description: This program presents a radio play of The Poor of New York by Dion Boucicault (1857).

node.title: "Fashion" by Anna Cora Mowatt
node.description: This program presents a radio play of Fashion by Anna Cora Mowatt (1845).

node.title: "Pocahontas" by John Brougham
node.description: This program presents a radio play of Pocahontas by John Brougham (1850).

node.title: "Metamora" by Robert M. Bird
node.description: This program presents a radio play of Metamora by Robert M. Bird (1836).

node.title: The Lion of the West
node.description: This program presents a staging of James Kirke Paulding's 1830 play, "The Lion of the West."

node.title: "Andre" by William Dunlap
node.description: This program presents a radio play of Andre by William Dunlap (1796).

node.title: "The Contrast" by Royall Tyler
node.description: This program presents a radio play of The Contrast by Royall Tyler (1787).
